review:
Um lugar onde piratas vagavam pelos mares em busca de tesouros, e onde uma inocente menina de 8 anos cresceu e se tornou a mais famosa Pirata do Caribe! Desde tenra idade, Morgane Castillo era uma menina confiante e mal-humorada, brincando com seus amigos e se envolvendo em Bounty Island.

Morando com a mãe e entediada com as tarefas e a vida na ilha, ela ansiava por ir para o mar, assim como seu pai pirata Alessandro! Mas ela era muito jovem e as meninas não deveriam se tornar piratas. Mas o início da vida de Morgane foi assolado pela tragédia.

Tio Eduardo, seu amigo mais querido, se perdeu no mar e sua mãe, Bonita Castillo, morreu repentinamente quando Morgane tinha apenas 8 anos. Acompanhe Morgane em sua busca para encontrar a lendária “Tartaruga Dourada” e experimente a história de uma jovem que se torna uma capitã pirata!

Tome decisões, mas lembre-se – suas ações têm consequências diretas para aqueles que dependem de você.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019195236', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1636757684}
review:
Bardzo dobrze udźwiękowiona przygodówka. Podkłady muzyczne dobrane idealnie i to do każdej sceny osobno. Bardzo uprzyjemnia to rozgrywkę. Bardzo dobra gra aktorska (voice acting) wszystkich postaci w grze, przy czym dosłownie wszystkie dialogi w grze są odegrane przez anglojęzycznych aktorów (oczywiście wyświetlają się też teksty). Dialogów i tekstów w grze jest bardzo dużo, ale wszystkie one mają sens i są często dowcipne.
Gra fabularnie jest długa, rozgrywa się w wielu lokacjach na kilku wyspach. Rozpoczynając grę należy przygotować się na długi rozwój wypadków, gdzie w międzyczasie dochodzą jeszcze nowe wątki. Pierwszy rozdział rozgrywa się w dzieciństwie bohaterki, a w następnych dziewięciu rozdziałach, gdzie rozgrywa się główny wątek fabularny, kierujemy już dorosłą Captain Morgane. Rozdziałów jest w sumie 10, a nie 5, tak jak w pewnym przewodniku na Steamie.
Aby gra działała płynnie trzeba doinstalować aplikację, która wyświetla grę w oknie (może ono być powiększone do wielkości całego ekranu i mieć wysoką rozdzielczość HD, więc nie czuje się różnicy). Ja użyłam aplikacji DxWnd dzięki czemu nie miałam żadnych problemów technicznych w grze. Dowiedziałam się o takim rozwiązaniu z wpisu (w "Centrum Społeczności" gry w Dyskusjach) gracza "webfischi" zatytułowanego "Got it running 60fps on Windows 10":
"There is almost no game dxwnd can't fix.
Download the current version of dxwnd, add the game exe and go to the 'Direct3D' tab. There is a section called 'Force Vertex Proc. / Execute Buffer' change it from 'Default' to 'mixed' and the game is fixed."
and:
"Open DXWnd and click on Edit > Add you should see a window now, with 3 rows of tabs on the top, if there are less, you have an older version, please update to at least v2.05.09
Enter any name you like, so you know which game it is, click on the 3 dots beside Path and select CaptainMorgane.exe in
[your path to the steam folder]\Steam\SteamApps\common\CaptainMorgane\
and uncheck everything on the Main tab, keep radio button on X,Y coordinates. Then follow the guide from the top of the discussion.
After that you can click Try... and when it works OK, after that you can start the game with the fix from inside DXWnd"

review: I would recommend this IF the major bug with the execution speed was fixed. In most scenes the characters move at about quarter pace. Dialogue audio runs smoothly but the character movements are way behind it and horribly, horribly slow. This happens when other characters are on screen, with a couple of exceptions. In scenes where Morgane is alone the speed is normal. As it is, it's unfit for purpose on my Win10 system. Which is a shame because it is graphically very appealing and otherwise has a lot to offer, harking back to the great days of graphical adventure games. Others seem to have had different mileage. If you can stand the walking-through-treacle pace of most of the game or are unaffected and are prepared to accept the click-constantly-to-continue dialogue, then it's worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037348918', 'num_games_owned': 2064, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1615750778}
review:
Before you can play fluently this game you first have to install and run 'dxwnd' on your computer. For more instructions you can check the topics here on steam. Then the game runs perfectly. I only don't understand why Steam itself doesn't tell you just in the gamedescription what you have to do to play this game on modern computers. If you are bothered about the fact your gamingtime on Steam doesn't count anymore: First run the game with 'dxwnd' and after that close the game immediately. When you run the game again with Steam after this, your gamingtime is working too again on Steam... 

About the game itself:
However sometimes the game could feel a bit repetive because you have to go many times from the same location to the other again and again... the story is pretty good. It's also an easy game to play and I have never been really stuck. I only recommend this game to real fans of classic, oldschool point & click adventuregames who likes to take their time to play. It's very important to do to the things in the right order and try the same things again in a later chapter. You can also find new objects to use in the game when you visit the same location again in another chapter. So take always a good look at the very small changes of the locations...

The music is pretty, but a bit repetive.

Not the best game, but also not too bad to say "no" in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1590777037}
review:
pros

+ beautiful looking, detailed and colorful hand drawn background artwork
+ when you press to space, hotspots highlighted so no need to pixel hunting.
+ typical but well-written and intriguing story about a female pirate's adventures and relationships with her family
+ well made graphic novel style cut scenes
+ there are some funny moments
+ many different, funny and colorful cast of well drawn characters
+ decent voice acting
+ nice musics
+ some enjoyable puzzles. they are not too easy or too difficult. there are also inventory puzzles you can combine some items
+ there is interactive map. you can instantly travel to another part of the island by clicking an icon
+ game is long. there are 10 chapters

cons

- game works with low framerate and laggy but when you download dxwnd and run game's exe with this program game works without a problem. that's why steam can't record my playtime.
- slow character animations. characters move slowly.
- sparse animation in cut scenes
- very easy and childish mini games.

Overall this is an typical, old school, decent and enjoyable point and click adventure game. i really like story and characters.

review:
Túto hru už mám niekoľko rokov, ale pre nezhody z predchádzajúcim počítačmi sa mi vytrvalo odmietala spustiť. I tak som ju z času na čas skúsila znova nahrať, až sa mi to teraz na mojom staro-novom počítači podarilo. A vyplatilo sa.
Príbeh malej Morgan, ktorá vyrástla v mladú ženu a pomaly sa spĺňa jej sen stať sa kapitánkou lode je iba jednou z mnohých dejových liniek, ktoré sa v tejto adventúre nachádzajú. I keď hľadanie zlatej korytnačky je samozrejme jej hlavným cieľom. 
Grafika je pekná, má nádherne kreslené lokácie, trocha mi vadilo, že postavy sú 3-D na 2-D pozadí, ale neskoršie som si toho prestala všímať. Najhoršie sú asi minihry, ani nie tak obtiažnosťou, ako grafikou, ktorá vyzerá ako vystrihnutá z webových flash hier. 
Obtiažnosť je tak stredná, občas sa zdá až veľmi ľahká, niekedy sa zaseknete, hlavne niektoré kombinácie v rámci inventára ma potrápili. 
Najviac sa mi ale aj tak asi páčilo hľadanie easter eggov z iných hier či anime, ktorými je táto hra okorenená, ale veľmi decentne sú zakomponované do pozadia, takže celkový dojem nerušia.

A pretty typical p&c adventure. A (somewhat) sassy (and father-obsessed) heroine becomes a pirate and goes on a quest to find the titular Golden Turtle. There's of course also an evil pirate antagonist (note how there's apparently space for "good pirates"). There isn't too much else to the story;  the family background was solid (Uncle Eduardo in particular, if you get what I mean. Not entirely sure what happened to the mother, though.) but there's no real tension or anything in the plot

Characters were okay; some aspects felt a bit rushed or chopped off (also within the world). Might be setting things up for a sequel that then never happened or hint at cut content; there's some bits of obvious changing around with this game (the main character still has some lines with old voice-acting, for example). Annoyingly, there's also the occasional proofreading miss.

The puzzles for the most part are okay; for a p&c they tend to err on the side of "too easy". Minigames are very simplistic, but you can skip them (press "cheat" for instant success. Who cares? You are a pirate). That being said, they are so easy I don't really see a point in it. The one thing that threw me occasionally - and frankly it's the same in (almost) every p&c - is "enforced playing order", ie not being allow to do certain actions before you've done certain other things. So you might not try X again because you don't realize that having done Y X now works ... if you've played a p&c, you know what I mean. It's okay if there's some logic behind it but sometimes it just feels random.

Overall fun enough. I didn't have any technical issues or anything, and with the current sale I'm content with what I got.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025403989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1563112682}
review:
Espressi un parere molto tempo fa su questo gioco, bocciandolo integralmente per l’impossibilità di poterlo giocare a causa di un problema che nacque dopo un aggiornamento di W10 che mise mani a qualche aspetto delle DX9 (librerie utilizzate dal gioco).

Oggi modifico quelle righe perché sono riuscito finalmente a giocarlo e finirlo, grazie a una dritta di un utente Steam che ha trovato un modo di poterlo giocare come era stato pensato, anche su W10 a 60 fps costanti e finalmente belli da vedere (mediante l’utilizzo di un piccolo software chiamato “dxwnd”, che va eseguito in modalità amministratore e non ha bisogno di installazioni, ma deve rimanere attivo durante l’esecuzione del gioco).

Nonostante questo e nonostante ritenga il gioco sulla piena sufficienza scolastica (ma non molto di più e fra poco vedremo perché), conservo il mio parere complessivo molto negativo perché la soluzione è “di terze parti”, per cui ritengo che sia più giusto punire il prodotto nella vetrina di Steam, in quanto gli sviluppatori hanno deciso di fottersene completamente. Buon per loro.

Ma perché mi ero fissato su questo gioco? Per due motivi:

1- è una avventura grafica di ambientazione piratesca e questo mi affascina da sempre;
2- la protagonista è gnocca;

Alla fin fine ho portato a termine il gioco in poco più di una decina di ore, quindi non è nemmeno troppo corto per il genere, tenendo conto che non si tratta nemmeno di una avventura dalla grande difficoltà. Tutto scorre abbastanza velocemente e sono rari i momenti in cui ci si bloccherà. Quindi, 11-12 ore di tante cose da vedere.

Il gioco prevede l’esplorazione di una manciata di isole, che man mano si sbloccano con il proseguimento della trama principale e gli enigmi su una isola in genere si risolvono sull’isola stessa, quindi sono rarissimi i momenti in cui serve qualche oggetto o qualche informazione da attingere altrove, ma sempre nelle immediate vicinanze, e questo è un merito che non rende frustrato il giocatore.

Gli enigmi sono spesso anche abbastanza simpatici e comunque tutti logici, e per la loro risoluzione a volte è necessario attivare linee di dialogo con gli NPC; infatti spesso e volentieri sono queste a triggerare gli eventi prossimi, come ad esempio anche la possibilità di utilizzare un oggetto dello scenario fino a quel momento non utilizzabile. Ma è tutto abbastanza chiaro quando lo giocherete, per cui non sarà mai un problema.

Nonostante la velocità dei frame finalmente riparata, il gioco è comunque sul lento andante. Non mi riferisco ai cambi di scenari, infatti la protagonista corre da sola quando si clicca sull’uscita distante di un quadro, ma a volte alla fine di qualche siparietto, bisogna aspettare che i protagonisti finiscano alcune animazioni e questo a volte diventa fastidioso (ad esempio, la stessa protagonista che sbatte i tacchi a terra o un NPC che deve uscire pian pianino dallo schermo). Ma anche questo è un problema sopportabile, perché alla fin fine non avrete mai davvero un fastidio.

I veri problemi nascono altrove (a parte quello di cui ho parlato all’inizio, che risulta il più grave).

1- l’atmosfera è carina ma purtroppo anche molto leggera e superficiale. Belle le locazioni, ma davvero pochissime quelle che provocano immersività o interesse;

2- la protagonista è gnocca, ma tutto quello che ruota intorno alla sua avventura è davvero molto stupido: il padre, famoso pirata decide di lasciare a lei ogni decisione, così lei possa provare il proprio valore. Non fa nulla se poi le cose peggiorano e il suo equipaggio verrà messo nei guai;

3- glitch! E questo è il problema principale. Sono incorso in due brutte situazioni, una che è un vero e proprio game breaking bug: nel capitolo 5 a un certo punto dovrete risolvere una questione nella vostra vecchia abitazione. Il problema è che il gioco permette di affrontare quella parte anche nel capitolo 4 se decideste di raggiungere l’abitazione di cui sopra anche se non servirebbe a nulla. Il gioco triggera ugualmente l’inizio della missione e una volta iniziata non è possibile uscirne se non la si conclude. Ecco, siccome non è prevista nel capitolo 4, la missione risulta completamente rotta e buggata, con difetti grafici anche nel suo svolgimento (oggetti che non dovrebbero esserci e che appaiono e personaggi che dovrebbero esserci ma che non ci sono). Il problema è che il gioco ha un solo save: se per caso salvate appena iniziata la missione nel capitolo 4 (missione che vi sarà data ufficialmente solo nel capitolo 5 però), siete fottuti. Dovete reiniziare il gioco da capo, perché rimarrete bloccati per sempre nell’abitazione. Questo è segnalato anche nel forum Steam e in qualche altro sito online, quindi… OCCHIO! Per fortuna io avevo il save precedente all’inizio della missione, e non l’ho sovrascritto.
Un secondo bug mi è accaduto proprio alla fine: uscendo da una capanna siamo circondati da guardie e dovremmo fare una certa cosa per allontanarle. Ecco, nel mio caso non è stato possibile perché un oggetto non era selezionabile. Anche qui potenzialmente è un game breaking bug, ma in quel caso il gioco permette l’uso del viaggio rapido sulla mappa, quindi è possibile sfuggire dalla situazione semplicemente usando la mappa. Un bug che permette di risolvere un bug. Assurdo. Ma meno male, almeno, sono riuscito a finirlo ugualmente.

Detto ciò, se volete perdonare la noncuranza degli sviluppatori verso il prodotto, sapendo che dxwnd è obbligatorio, potete farci un pensierino. Non è davvero male.

Ultime cosine: 

- il gioco prevede anche una manciata di sotto giochi arcade, ma sono molto facili e saltabili;
- ci sono anche scene animate di intermezzo tra alcuni eventi. Morgane negli sketch non assomiglia minimamente al personaggio poligonale a schermo (peccato perché nei primi è molto più affascinante);
- l’overlay Steam non funziona. Fraps va bene per gli screenshot. MSI invece nel mio caso entrava in conflitto con dxwnd, quindi non ho potuto utilizzarlo.

0/10 per il problema sulle librerie.
6/10 per la qualità intrinseca del gioco, e tenendo conto dei bug.

Decidete voi.

TLDR: Charming looking spanish bucaneer point&click adventure made unusuable by an extremely sluggish engine and no dev support. Looks to be abandonned.

This game used to run better and eventually started having the same issue. Sluggish mouse movements, single digit frames per seconds. There is no acknowledgement from anyone selling this game that the issue exists or that they intended to fix it.

I have had pleasant surprises in the past such as when Ghosts of Voojoo island got fixed by their devteam so I was holding out from removing this game from library in hope of a similar fix.

However after waiting for well over a year it does not seem that the day will come. From glancing at it this seemed like a somewhat low budget but decently realized adventure game. With casualized hotspot-based interaction, servicable voice acting with decent inflections and interesting accents. 

I think I will just end up watching a lets play of the whole playthrough on youtube and might comment on what I thought of the plot as an added note to thsi review. However for purposes of gaming I am going to remove local contents permanently and hide this game for declutter.

Please notify me if the game gets ever fixed and I might consider reintroducing it to my collection.

review:
[h1] Information [/h1]

Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle ist ein mitreißendes Karibik-Abenteuer, das aus der Feder des Erfolgsautors Steve Ince (Baphomet’s Fluch) stammt. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

In Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle spielst du die Rolle, der hübschen Morgane Castillo, Tochter eines ruhmreichen Piratenkapitäns mit einer schicksalhaften Vergangenheit. Begebe dich in eine humorvoll und farbenfroh gestaltete Welt und erleben hautnah wie Morgane von einem unschuldigen 8-jährigen Mädchen zu einer der berühmtesten Piratinnen der Karibik heranwächst und versuche, in die Fußstapfen deines Vaters zu treten. Als erster weiblicher Kapitän der Karibik machst du dich mit deiner Crew auf die abenteuerliche Reise. Du durchquerst nicht nur gefährliche Gewässer, sondern auch fünf exotische Inseln und löst dutzende knifflige Rätsel.
 
[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ spannendes Abenteuer
+ atemberaubende Schauplätze
+ viele Charaktere
+ knifflige Rätsel
+ Minispiele
+ gute Grafik und Sound
+ Kinder freundlich
+ Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- schlechte Synchronisation
- Dialoge müssen immer durch klicken der Maustaste fortgeführt werden
- Geschichte kommt nur langsam voran 

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle ist ein wirklich tolles Point & Click-Adventure mit einer gelungen Grafik und enormen Umfang für wenig Geld.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999921146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1476090354}
review:
Bon... Ce n'est pas le Point and Click de l'année... Malgré la localisation Française complète (texte et voix), pas mal de petits trucs ne m'ont pas permis de l'apprécier totalement.

Les graphismes sont assez inégaux, si les décors sont plutôt bien faits, les animations pourtant nombreuses ne rendent pas toujours bien.

Le GamePlay est classique, on dispose d'un inventaire dans lequel on peut combiner des objets, reste ensuite à les utiliser dans l'environnement. Les déplacements ne sont pas parfaits, notamment le passage vers le bord des tableaux (il faut parfois clicker plusieurs fois pour que l'héroine se déplace). Les mini-jeux ne sont pas transendants non plus.

Les boites de dialogues, avec le texte écrit en gros (bon point pour moi), m'ont parues lentes et pas des plus fluides (beaucoup de clics nécéssaires pour "passer" à la suite) pour les nombreuses discussions.

Le jeu est relativement facile, avec la multiplication des zones visitées la difficulté augmente un peu mais souvent on n'a pas besoin d'aller très loin pour trouver tous les objets nécessaires aux énigmes, à noter que globalement les combinaisons sont relativement logiques.

L'aventure en elle même n'a pas été très passionnante, il y a quand même quelques bonnes idées, avec un petit côté enfantin (et faut que je le teste avec mes enfants), et malgré un désir de rendre l'univers amusant (notamment par de nombreux clins d'oeil: Galactica, Bob l'éponge, star Wars...) je n'ai pas vraiment accroché.

Décomposée en 10 chapitres, il vous faudra une dizaine d'heures pour boucler l'histoire.

A prendre à (très) petit prix.

review:
Vous aimez l'univers de la Piraterie ?! Alors vous apprécierez de partir à l'aventure dans les Caraïbes avec Captain Morgane et la Tortue d'Or !

Le scénario est tout aussi captivant que celui de So Blonde qui se déroullait essentiellement sur l'Ile Oubliée ! On y retrouve des personnages phares de la saga comme Sunny ou encore le redoutable Hillary Simpkins !

review:
I just finished this game and I actually enjoyed it quite a bit. I'm a fan of point-and-click adventure games and if someone were to tell me this is a game that came out in 1998, I would believe you as it feels right at home there. Like adventure games of that era, you've got funny and obscure solutions to problems and even a handful of minigames thrown in (with a surprisingly chibi style in a few of them). As it has been noted by others, for some reason the game does not start with a setup menu or even has a good one in-game. HIGHLY recommended to run "settings" in the captain morgane steam folder (common standard being steam/steamapps/common/captainmorgane) and you can then adjust it for higher qualitiy and widescreen mode. 

I found the acting to be very good. None of the performances took me out of the atmosphere and all of the accents felt like they belong there. The music was excellent and I enjoyed all of the soundtrack even if it was a bit repetetive. Like the games of the 90's, though, that was fairly common and since it is caribbean themed and light it doesn't get annoying.

Other than a few minor bugs here and there, this was an adventure game worth playing if you're into adventure games. Since Monkey Island always has a soft spot in my heart, any pirate-themed adventure game set in the caribbean will spark my interest. :)

TL;DR - Good adventure game for anyone looking for a pirate style point-and-click adventure. Bad game for FPS players who need to kill stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1451165763}
review:
[b][i]Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle[/i][/b] is a point & click adventure game. As her father gives her command of the ship for her birthday, Morgane accepts a charter to seek out the legendary Golden Turtle by following a trail of clues the famous explorer Buckleberry Tanner left behind him.

[b]Pros[/b]: The point & click genre is well represented as you pick up a whole assortment of objects and trinkets on your adventure, using them and combining them in creative and often funny ways to progress in the story. You come across a couple of strange or wacky characters on your adventure, and there's a few out-of-place reference to other games and movies in a hit-and-miss attempt to mimic the humor found in golden age Sierra and LucasArts games. The voice acting is ok, at least for the most part, and backgrounds look like the caricatural hand drawn style you'd expect. The story is child-friendly, and you must keep in mind that it's likely the target audience of the game as there is little to no jokes, not even subtle ones, targeted at a more mature audience.

[b]Cons[/b]: The characters' 3D sprites clash strongly with the 2D cartoony background, and I'm not convinced it was the best choice. The story is short, and the puzzles aren't enough to make it the lengthy experience a [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/32360/][i]Monkey Island[/i][/url] or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/10110/][i]Space Quest[/i][/url] game would be. Some jokes are corny even for children, I wouldn't even expect any giggle from a younger player.

[b]Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - It's up to you

I'll recommend this for younger players looking for slightly challenging puzzles, but adults will find it easy and perhaps even a bit of a boring tale. It doesn't quite reach the levels of other point & click, but although I'm not the player this game is for, it still gets an "ok" from me.

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

review:
Pros:

+Bright, beautiful colors that go well with the theme of the game.
+Very artistic and detailed in every scene. No scene is the same or resembles any other scene in the game. 
+Music that fits the game perfectly and doesn’t try to sound overpowering.
+Fully voiced dialogue – well rehearsed and done nicely by the cast who did the voices. 
+No Crashes and/or Bugs that I am aware of.
+Pirates, treasure, and an adventure!


Cons:

-No options in the menu. All you can do is change the voice dialogue and text of the language to English, French, German, Italian, or Spanish. 
-Resolution did not match that of my native resolution (had black bars on both sides of the actual gameplay, but the screenshots show in full resolution).
-The animation of the actual characters on the screen could have used a lot more polish. I would say some of the characters would compare well with some PlayStation 2 characters.


This is my first Point and Click adventure game. It was a fun little game and it was enjoyable. The puzzles and combination of items weren’t difficult even though at times there were some tricky ones. The game had some flaws, but nothing game breaking. I didn’t experience any bugs, crashes, or anything of similar nature. 

The story was decent and it introduced some funny, wacky characters along your adventures. The cast did a nice job on voice acting and from what I’ve read and heard on the forums, the original voices were replaced with new voices that matched the actual characters (hearing the first video to the third video on the actual store page is a HUGE difference – big plus on my end!). There are some nice jokes and a few Easter Eggs within the text. 

The theme of the game is around the Caribbean Sea. You’re a young pirate woman who wants to prove to everyone that you can be the next best pirate captain. You have a lot of obstacles and convincing of others in order to make this dream happen. You’ll encounter rivals and haters who will want to end your dreams. There are some moments where the female protagonist has to help others out on their own personal agenda in order to progress further on her own adventure (this gives a bit more background story on those individual characters that help you along your journey). 

As long as you have an open mind, don’t hate pirates, know that this isn’t a RPG; like treasures and an adventure – I would recommend this game to anyone who likes point and click games. I did enjoy this game and would give a 7/10.

review:
"And as he fell down to the depths
 He swore a deadly curse
"As sure as hell's my final fate
You'll all soon die, or worse"
             - Captain Morgan's Revenge (Alestorm)

Йох-хо-хо...хо...хо... WTF?

Квест на пиратскую тематику, как-бы с юморком, как-бы с заявкой на победу. Квест встречает нас годной рисовкой, вихри враждебные реют над судном, молнии рассекают небеса на части, людей смывает нафиг с палубы, суровые мужики борются за жизнь, суровый капитан рыдает... Эээ.Это что было?! Скорее всего показалось. Интерлюдия завершена, начинается игра.
Вот что не отнять так это годную двухмерность, нарисовано со вкусом, красочно, женские персонажи как-будто с порностудии сбежали на секундочку, по дружбе чтоль поучаствовать. Но рано радоваться игра ведь без рейтинговых ограничений (ну или 12+ там, не помню), трехмерная анимация это... да... вот это да... Контраст заметен не вооруженным глазом -  трехмерные уроды персонажи против красивых рисованных видов. Хрен бы с уродами. Ведь может в душе они добрые? 
Вот девочка тихоня и мальчик ссыкло боятся хулигана, приходит дочка сурового рыдающего капитана и хочет помочь друзьям, но как?? Может быть отхерачить дубьем плохиша, связать и его и скинуть его нахер с обрыва? Даааа! так и сделаем!!!
Вот плохиш с братом занимаются гоп-стопом и мешает дочурке к мамке с папкой прибежать, что же делать доброй девочке? Может  сделать факел и тыкать тыкать им в морду ослу, чтобы перепуганное животной затоптало нахуй гоп-стоперов? Дааааа! так и сделаем!!!
Все бы ничего. Даже непобоюсь уебищная анимация персонажей, настоящий суровый рыдающий (через раз) капитан, попытки научить людей доброму ввиде поджига животных и битье лежачих, порностарных артов (хотя чей-то я) не помешали бы поставить отрицаловку если бы...
Вот каким надо быть ебанутым, что бы придумать такое -  со дна морского как достать обордажную саблю? Взяяять маааленький магнит и поводить над водой - сабля сама поднимется. (ладно хер с ним, все таки магнетизм - хоть какая то логика есть), но почему... Нет, вернее каким сральником надо было думать, чтобы придумывать вскрывать замок сундука куриной косточкой, сука куриной косточкой из крылышка, из крылышка бля. 

Действитель пророческая строчка "You'll all soon die, or worse". Вот это or worse и есть Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle

author: {'steamid': '76561198017056179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1430743459}
review:
Das Spiel ist leider ziemlich Schrott, höchstens für Adventure-Fans:
Die Hintergrundmusik ist wenig abwechslungsreich und wird dadurch schnell nervtötend
Eins der Mini-Spiele ist eine Slotmaschine... Glücksspiel in einem Spiel für Kinder?? 
Morgane gibt kaum Feedback, wenn man eine falsche Kombination ausprobiert.
Die Übersetzung ist grauenhaft. Teilweise falsch, fehlerhaft, unvollständig und mit Rechtschreibfehlern. Und die Synchronsprecher!!! Die Dialoge sind auch eine Qual. Nach jedem Satz einmal klicken, damit es weitergeht. 
Die Kamerasteuerung ist ein Witz. Manche Interaktionen sind erst möglich, nachdem man den Bildausschnitt verändert hat. Und das ist ziemliche Glückssache, weil Morgane sich nicht immer zielgerichtet bewegen lässt. Aus Frust hab ich mit dann den Walkthrough angeschaut, den ich hier leider nicht kopieren darf, aber mal verlinke: http://www.playstationtrophies.org/forum/captain-morgane-and-the-golden-turtle/191427-captain-morgane-golden-turtle-complete-walkthrough.html
Und was kommt dabei heraus?? Das ist ein Konsolenspiel, dass für PC aufbereitet wurde. Und die PS3-Erfolge sind natürlich nicht auch als Steam-Erfolge möglich. Nach kurze Recherche hab ich herausgefunden, dass der Publisher insolvent ist. Kein Wunder bei solchen Spielen. Aber das ein deutscher Publisher die Übersetzung und deutsche Synchro vergeigt??
Lustig war eigentlich nur, die Locations nach Easter-Eggs abzusuchen. So hängt in der Gaststätte auf Crab Island ein Poster von Mr. Krabs aus Spongebob an der Wand. Oder in der Vorratskammer hängt ein Metroid von Nintendos Super Metroid. Davon gibts in dem Spiel haufenweise.
FAZIT:
Low Budget Spiel. Wer sichs antun will, sollte nur zugreifen, wenns mal wieder Rabatte gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154757644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1430481307}
review:
Great point and click adventure.

I completed the adventure as it should be completed, with no hints or peeks at walkthroughs. It took me about 18 hours, so those people who claim to have finished this in 6 hours can only have used walkthroughs. 

There are 10 chapters and each chapter progresses the story very nicely.

What I loved about this title was the dialogue, which was funny and made perfect sense. The voices of the many characters were all really well done and very much added to the atmosphere. Some of the characters are particularly brilliant, such as the debonnaire but daft Briscoe, the fabulous Buck who reminded me of so many people I've met in SE Asia (the developers really nailed that character), Sonia is the most hilarious and cagey dock side 'worker' ever, and of course the lead character, Morgaine, is a superb act. There are many more great and wacky characters that will be encountered that really do a great job.

The story is very interesting and really gets going in chapter 2. I have seen reviews criticising chapter 1, but it's a cute, short introductory chapter and great for story background. and takes about 45 minutes to playthrough. The ultimate quest, introduced by the eccentric English gentleman, Briscoe, is always the aim, though the journey there will take many twists and turns with lots of side quests.

I don't want to give away any of the plot, but I'll just say that the way the story dealt with a sad death was very touching indeed and one of the peaks of the title.

The graphics are bright and colourful and their cartoony style do the story lots of justice. Well done to the graphics team.

The puzzles are mostly fetch quests, dialogue threads and inventory matching. While these are mostly fun and do require thought and LOTS of experimentation, it would have been nice to have thrown in some other types of puzzles too. The few mini game type puzzles are on the weak side,

I liked the control system of clicking the dialogue to move it on as that way I didn't miss any important information and it allowed me to read it while listening, at my own speed. A good system. The inventory, as mentioned above, does require a lot of trial and error, but is perfectly fine.

So, overall, I really enjoyed this game, though I was not sure I would before I started playing it. I would strongly recommend it for  15 plus very entertaining hours (if played with no hints).

review:
A childrens' point and click adventure. Visuals and animations are mediocre, story and voice acting is decent, and minigames are very simple. I can't find a way to speed up/skip walking animations and you can only save to one save slot, but otherwise it's just another point-and-click adventure game. It will teach kids to start fires, animal cruelty, lie, cheat, steal, gamble, and to interrupt their parents' cuddle time. Not a game for everyone, but maybe it's something you'd play along with your kid who likes pirates (some solutions, like in every adventure game, are a bit out there and might need walkthrough help).

Things you need to know (but aren't shown anywhere):
1) In the steam game folder, use 'settings.exe' to change resolution and toggle fullscreen/windowed mode.
2) In order to use items, right-click to open the menu, then left-click and drag the item towards the bottom of the screen (to exit the menu while holding the item), hover over the thing you want to use it on and then let go of the mouse button.
3) You can combine items in the menu by dragging one onto another.
4) The menu has a map that lets you move to other areas later in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962216885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1420976315}
review:
Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle is a low budget title that is a little rough around the edges but overall is an enjoyable game. It took around 14 hours to beat (perhaps less, some people say 8). The game isn't really too hard and there is no way to lose really. It's got some charming characters. The writing isn't always funny but at least it tries to be. The story isn't too bad, in fact it was somewhat refreshing. I guess this game has ties to another game from the same writer/developer called "So Blonde" but it's not on steam. Someone greenlight it! The game even has voice acting and for the most part they do a solid job.

I liked the 2D artwork, the 3D however leaves something to be desired. Also, not too fond of how the same character will look off model in a different piece of artwork, like in the cut scenes Morgane will look off. Sometimes they look odd even in the character portraits in the dialogue. Another thing that would be desirable would be steam achievements. It appears the Playstation version has trophies so it is odd the steam version doesn't have something similar. It does have cards though!

Overall if you're into point and click games, female protagonists and lighthearted stories you should probably check this out.

review:
This game is probably worth the price charged.  Probably.

I mean, don't get me wrong, I got it as a gift and had it on my wishlist because I thought another adventure game with a female protagonist would be cool.

However, it feels like it was written haphazardly and the art style is...well.

I feel they may have underpaid their artists.

The minigames make me wonder if this is supposed to be a kid's game, but the quality (especially of the sword fight; the graphics literally made me want to stop playing the game, and using ctrl and alt?  What is this?  There are many other keys that are good for sword fighting that are not related to system functions like z and x or a and s!) is a little disgusting in that respect.

Either way, it is not horrible game.  It suffers from usual adventure game problem of trying to grind everything on your inventory with every other thing in your inventory and everything in the environment, but that is normal.

I would not get this for a friend even if they loved adventure games unless they were truly desperate, but it is good enough that I can actually play it.

Wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026434230', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1414060185}
review:
Если вы играли, когда-нибудь (а скорее всего давно) в  point and click адвенчуру [b]"So blonde"[/b] (Итак, блондинка), или в нашей локализации от Буки [b]"Блондинка в шоке! Бермудские страсти."[/b], то вы не должны пройти и мимо этой игры.
Сразу напишу, что локализация "блондинки" от Буки, просто чудесна. Актёры озвучили так как надо, с выражениями, с юмором.
В [b]"Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle"[/b], к сожалению нет нашей локализации, но можно найти руссификатор текста. Например, на ZoG.
Игра, как и предшедственница замечательная, с юмором. Пусть не с таким смехом проходится, как в случае с [b]"So blonde"[/b], когда ты представлюешь вживую блондинку с её разумом и с её "умением" реагировать на ту, или иную ситуацию. [spoiler]Ближе к финалу же блондинка умнеет и становится уже вполне разумной, поумневшей девушкой способной на такие поступки, которые и не всякий  мужчина может себе позволить.[/spoiler] Так и в капитане Морганы, мы по ходу игры видим перемены происходящие с ней, как она из маленькой девчонки, превращается в "морскую волчицу", которую уже слушаются матёрые пираты.
В игре много отсылов к первой игре. Хотя сюжет развивается немного раньше сюжета в [b]"So blonde"[/b] . Фактически можно начинать с любой части и наслаждаться игрой. Встречаются локации и люди с первой игры. Когда бродишь по этим локациям, ностальжи нет, нет, да и проснётся...
Игра берёт свой детальной прорисовкой окружения. Очень красочно и сочно (как и должно быть на Карибах). Почти все загадки логичны и не требуют сверхусилий. есть небольшие несуразные моменты, когда Моргана, например, пихает под свой жакетик бревно... Хммм.. Конечно, "бездонный карман" присущ, очень многим квестам.. Но не настолько же?! Есть ещё пару мелочей, однотонный процесс игры..
Но всё же советую брать на абордаж.  Тем более пираты, тем более девушка! 7,5 галлонов рома из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4165, 'num_reviews': 732, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1411000941}
review:
Capitaine Morgane, l'héroïne, est très belle mais hélas, comme dans beaucoup de point and click, se déplace comme un concombre à roulette.

Les décors sont sympathiques, les voix des personnages collent à la perfection avec leur visage et j'ai adoré le lien qui a été fait avec So Blonde (l'île, les mêmes décors, ...) ! Mais, à côté de ça, j'ai trouvé les énigmes un peu trop simples à certains moments, les mini-jeux n'étaient pas exceptionnels et, surtout, je n'ai pas du tout apprécié la typographie utilisée pour les paroles. On dirait qu'ils sont passés à la va-vite sur ce point alors que les dialogues sont très fréquents dans le jeu ... 

Cette aventure éparpillée sur 5 îles permet au joueur de résoudre tout de même un bon nombre d'énigmes de niveaux très variés. Le scénario et les graphismes sont d'une grande fraîcheur. Il y a quelques rebondissements. Environ 10 heures de jeu sont nécessaires pour démêler l'intrigue et trouver la fameuse tortue d'Or. Je le conseille pour passer un moment simplement agréable >> 14/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1410087414}
review:
"Captain Morgae and the Golden Turtle" es uno de los juegos que más escepticismo me provocaban. Me gustan las aventuras gráficas, me gustan los piratas y odio la mojigatería actual, y este juego, a juzgar por lo que podía ver era una aventura chorra y simplona para gente que ni siquiera se molestaría en acabarla, con una historia de piratas protagonizada por chicas estilo Bratz para crías gritonas y sin un solo taco ni meada fuera de tiesto, no sea que la recta moral de la juventud se perturbe. Es decir, un ñordo de juego de campeonato.
Si os digo la verdad, lo que os vais a encontrar huele a eso, pero no es tan acentuado como pensaba. Es cierto que es una aventura gráfica sencilla, pero no tanto como otras que he jugado. El planetamiento es realmente estúpido: a Morgane, que es la protagonista, le gusta la vida pirata, que por definición, se mueven fuera de la ley, pero es una cría mojigata, ñoña y pedante. Nada que ver con lo que busca alguien en un juego, supuestamente, de piratas. Mi idea era capturar barcos, robar tesoros y hacer de Morgane la Golfa de los 7 Mares, así, en mayúsculas, pero olvidaos de eso.
De vez en cuando aparece el típico minijuego, que se nota que los han hecho sin ganas, y del que paso de hablar ya que no merecen ser nombrados.
Los escenarios están graciosos y bien dibujados, con montones de referencias a cosas conocidas como la lata de sopa Campbell's o Mr. Potato, pero se nota que lo han hecho para "molar más", ya que se nota que los han puesto al tuntún.
Los personajes son idiotas. Tamto, que en un concurso de idiotas se quedarían en segunda posición. Por idiotas.
En definitiva, me esperaba un truñaco inmenso y lo que encontré fue un truño menor, pero truño, orientado a crías sin el menos sentido crítico y que juegan de forma más o menos casual. Si lo jugáis, que sea porque no tenéis otro juego con el que quitaros el mono de aventura gráfica.

[b]Ya estás ofendiendo... Las crías también tienen derecho a jugar, ¿no? Son crías pequeñas.[/b] ¿Y qué tiene eso que ver para que el juego no sea un truño?
[b]¿A qué te refieres con casual? ¿Es corta y repleta de minijuegos?[/b] No excesivamente corta, y minijuegos creo que hay uno por capítulo (de un total de 7 u 8, creo), pero los puzzles son sencillos y poco trabajados.

review:
[h1]Hi, [/h1]
ich hab mir das Spiel hier angesichts des Titels, Preises und Genres zugelegt. 
Normalerweise bin ich (fast) nur für Shooter oder irgendetwas damit verbundenes zu haben, aber damals hatte ich auch sehr gerne die TKKG-Spiele gezockt. Letztens auch den kostenlosen Teil von Baphomet's Fluch.


[b] Pro:[/b] 
+ Grafik-Style (halt mal was anderes und wenn man die Einstellungen manuell im Ordner per Settings.exe hochstellt, isses auch für meinen Anspruch genügsam
+ Gags (Natürlich ist Humor subjektiv, aber ich mochte ihn - s. meine Screenshots ;)
+ Motivation durch kleine Schritte des Weiterkommens
+ Story interessant - auch noch nach 10 Stunden Spielzeit :)
+ "Rätsel" relativ unterschiedlich schwer zu lösen


[b] Contra:[/b] 
- Unsere Captaine bewegt sich für meine Begriffe oft zu langsam von A nach B -> nervt auf Dauer
- Mono-/Dialoge oft über mehrere "Seiten" -> jede Message weiterklicken zu müssen nervt
- Frust kommt auf, wenn man einfach nicht weiterkommt und es sich nicht durch Hilfen leicht/er machen will
- Für ungeduldige Typen wie mich wirklich oft ne reine Probe; wenn man eine klitzekleine Sache übersieht, kommt man ja einfach bei dieser Spielform nicht weiter


[u]FAZIT[/u]: Das liest sich jetzt vllt 50:50, aber da die negativen Punkte eher subjektiv anzusehen sind und somit nicht für jeden zutreffen mögen, überwiegen ganz klar die unterschiedlichen Pluspunkte! Und hey...1-5€ oder so!? Ich bitte euch! Give it a try! ;>

BTW: Die angesprochene Kritik bzgl. der nervigen Stimmen am Anfang sind zwar richtig, dennoch ist man da noch n kleines Mädchen, weshalb die Stimmen einfach doof verstellt wurden. Wenn man sich aber allein das Cover anguckt und 1+1 zusammen zählt, könnte man auf den Trichter kommen, dass dies nicht so bleibt und man schon bald erwachsen/er ist + die normale Stimme weitaus angenehmer zu hören ist. 
(Die 2. Möglichkeit wäre immer noch, die Stimmausgabe auf Englisch umzustellen.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030605762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1402420467}
review:
Won my affections despite some serious flaws. Let me start with what is bad about this game. First, the story wanders all over the place and about 1/2 half of it could have been cut without any serious damage to the plot. Further, while there is a villian in the game he gets no character development. Second, the game relies on too many puzzles that are tedious--there is a place in the game where a written confession is needed and there are ten steps required to make the confession from producing the ink to getting a writing insturment. It takes a certain degree of patience to make it through Captain Morgane. My own strategy was when I found the game boring I started looking at a walkthrough until  the game seemed to pick up speed.

So what is good about the game? First, although the story wanders it does feature some nice plot twists. There is a genuine sense of adventure and of the unexpected. Second, the game flashes some moments of genuine humor. I won't spoil all of them but I'll mention one snarky bit, "She had the type of face that lauched a 1000 ships. That's why it looked so battered." ZING. There is even a Star Trek reference. Third, some of the characters one meets in the game are well-defined. The heroine of the game--Captain Morgane--is well-crafted as well as some of the minor characters. Finally, the game is nice to look at.

Overall, I found playing this game fun. True it doesn't rival Broken Sword or The Longest Journey but it's still is an above average adventure game. It took me about nine hours to finish and I don't regret the time spent.

It's a nice game with nice puzzles, and this comes from an old school palyer (zack, day of the tentacle, full throttle,  discworld, the dig, monkey island, grim fandango and so on). It's true the game fails in making the player laugh, but the puzzles and the story are fine... yes, some are illogical, but the gameplay is decent enough.

This game is the opposite: it's a little harder but the jokes are terrible. Still, give it a try if you can buy this game for cheap. It's not worth the full price.

review: This game is boring. Boring. BORING. Who would have thought that a classic-style adventure game set in the Caribbean, a game in which you play as a strong-willed girl who wants to live up to the legacy of her long-lost pirate father, a game in which you hunt for treasure and captain a crew of ragged misfits, could turn out to be so profoundly, mind-bendingly DULL? The characters wind up being unengaging, the narrative drags and drags and drags, and the mechanics are awkward at best. I only spent $6 on this and if I could I'd demand my money back.

review:
I don't know if I have the patience to finish this one, folks. Even though the artwork is fantastic, which has gotten me through several hours, this gameplay is wretched. You may have already read about the fact that you must click after ever single sentence just to get the next sentence or action to take place. I can almost handle that. The puzzles are uninteresting, but when you complete one and talk to a character about it, they still try to give you clues about that same puzzle. Add the fact that the navigation is slow and the writers obviously think they're hilarious and you have yourself a meh experience so much so that I need a really long run-on sentence to describe it.

Go find another point & click adventure.

review:
First of all, please be patient and give this game a chance. You just have to overcome the first chapter, after that the game is getting better and better. Captain Morgane and the Golden Turtle is a classic point and click adventure game. The story isn't that good but still adventurous. The backgrounds and the characters are very beautiful. I played the english version and I gotta say I really liked the dialogues and the voice acting. Especially Morganes spanish accent. There are lots of references to the modern pop culture during the entire game. I had some funny moments. In my opinion, the game is a little too childish sometimes. Be aware of that. I think I don't have to tell anything detailed about the story. It's already written in the game description. 


pros and cons:

pros:
 - beautiful locations/backgrounds
 - cute characters
 - voice acting (Important: This refers to the english version! The german voice acting on the      
   other hand is one of the worst synchronization I've ever heard)
 - low price!
 - funny references to other games, movies and books (Battlestar Galactica, Steve Jobs, so 
   Blonde...)
 - not the best but still an entertaining story (I mean after chapter 1)
    

cons: 
 - tiring beginning (especially chapter 1)
 - rather easy puzzles
 - you have to click left mouse button after each dialogue line to continue the dialogue


After all, Captain Morgane is not such a bad game. If You like point and click adventures, I would recommend it. 
I've really enjoyed it.    7/10

review:
Je possedais déjà le jeu avant sa sortie steam, s'il vous plait ne tenez pas compte du temps passé sur Captain Morgane.

So blonde se voulait déjà être la fille spirituelle de Secret of Monkey Island grace à un univers pirate emprunt d'humour. Nous voilà de retour dans cet univers au coté de Morgane Castillo, plantureuse et volcanique capitaine pirate, dans ses chasses au trésors.

Les animations du jeu ne sont pas top et des fois pas à la hauteur des décors et les vignettes qui eux sont super soignés. Un doublage en dent de scies mais que je trouve personnellement charmant, des énigmes parfois tordu et pas logique et une bonne poignée de mini jeux. Mine de rien, Captain Morgane est un titre très sympas pour ceux qui veulent leur dose de flibusteries.

J'espere voir bientot sur Steam les deux So Blonde (y compris la version "gaiden" de la Wii).

review:
Not bad! The backgrounds are great, the character art's cute and engaging, the voice acting's better than I expected and the puzzles and gameplay are pretty good. There's a few minor hiccups like items the character won't take until she knows she need it (I hate that!) and one or two complex puzzles that seem to get slightly buggy if you don't do things in precise order. Overall though, these flaws were very minor and don't detract from the gameplay. There are also a few minigames just for variety, but nothing anybody will find overly taxing. These can be skipped if so desired.

This game is a modern point-and-click adventure game. That means relatively limited interface options and relatively few interactable items per screen. This is a fairly good example of the genre, but if you're not a fan of point-and-click adventure, this won't be the game to change your mind.
